name: lorry production, 28 metric ton | lorry, 28 metric ton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8691/documentation

This dataset represents the production of one lorry 28 t. The disposal of lorry is included too.

The dataset starts with the material used for the production of the lorry.

The dataset ends with the production of one lorry 28 t. The dataset includes the material used for the production, the energy consumption of the building machines, the water consumption, the airborne emissions and  until and including the emissions to water. Vehicle disposal is as well included.
category: C:Manufacturing/29:Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers/291:Manufacture of motor vehicles/2910:Manufacture of motor vehicles

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Based on the material consumption of a Volvo truck (available from product declaration Volvo Truck Corporation (2004)). The figures presented for energy consumption and airborne emissions are used for all lorry (Heavy-Duty vehicle) classes regardless of vehicle weight category. Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a;German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000). The total value used in this study comprises stamping processes, metal part and wiring harness manufacturing,;engine production and testing as well as the final assembly. Is assumed that diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is;modeled as building machine. Based on the diesel consumption for engine testing, direct environmental emissions to air are calculated, employing the emission profile of a lorry 28t empty. NMVOC emission also include emissions;of solvents (7.2 kg/lorry) used in manufacturing (95% in the final assembly). About 95% of the consumed tap water and groundwater are used in the final assembly of vehicles (own calculations based on MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002)). About 45’000 m3 of the drinking water are used for the production of de-ionised water. De-ioinsed water is used for painting processes. For the production of de-ionised water both, reverse-osmosis (20%) and ion-exchanger (80%)1 are used. About 65’000 m3 of the water output are treated at the plant; 60’000 m3 are neutralised using FE(III)Cl-precipitation and the remaining 5000 m3 are treated with ultra filtration. Among the water leaving the plant, about 50,000 m3 are contaminated. In Table 5-68 the contaminations are summarised. In this study for the calculation of the resulting environmental exchanges a particular module has been generated: “treatment lorry production effluent, to wastewater treatment, class 1” (see Doka (2003)). For rail- and road transport of materials, are employed standard distances as documented in;Frischknecht & Jungbluth (2003) to account for environmental interventions due to essential transport services in the vehicle production.;References:;Volvo Truck Corporation (2004) Environmental product declaration: Volvo 8500 Low-Entry. Download of March from http://www.volvo.com/bus/global/en-gb/volvogroup/core+values/environment/downloads.htm.;MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) Umwelterklärung 1999. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München;MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München;Doka G. (2003) Life Cycle Inventories of Waste Treatment Services. Final report ecoinvent 2000 No. 13. EMPA St. Gallen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Duebendorf, CH, Online-Version under: www.ecoinvent.ch.;Frischknecht R. and Jungbluth N. (2003) Code of Practice. Final report ecoinvent 2000 No. 2. ESU-services, Uster, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Duebendorf, CH, Online-Version under: www.ecoinvent.ch.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Vehicle manufacturing data are taken from one production site in  Germany.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology, environmental issues have been addressed in the past.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from one production site in Germany is used as an first estimate for Europe
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data is taken from an environmental report of one production site. Additional data was generated via oral communcation.

Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000)andMAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000). The data is available for various manufacturing sites performing different tasks in the manufacturing chain. The total value used in this study comprises stamping processes, metal part and wiring harness  manufacturing, engine production and testing as well as the final assembly.

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Based on the diesel consumption for engine testing, direct environmental emissions to air are calculated, employing the emission profile of a lorry 28t empty. Is assumed that diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is modeled as building machine.Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002).

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.
